title: Chief Technology Officer
shortDescription:
- Unify and modernize a 17+ product portfolio into a single scalable, cloud-first, AI-enabled platform.
- Lead a globally distributed engineering org (150–500+ engineers) across multiple hubs (US/India/Europe).
- Drive platform simplification, engineering KPIs/operating cadence, and cost/quality improvements in a PE-backed environment.
- Customer-facing with enterprise accounts; support future M&A diligence and integrations.
fitRationale:
- Strong match to platform consolidation + architecture governance + operating-model work at scale.
- AI-enabled platform shift + multi-product unification is a clean ‘enterprise transformation’ narrative.
- PE value-creation framing (cost/velocity/quality) aligns with ‘trust + performance at scale’ execution discipline.

title: Senior Vice President of Data & Infrastructure
shortDescription:
- Report to CTO; oversee 80–100 engineers across data infrastructure (ingestion, prediction, measurement, exchanges).
- Own build/buy/partner strategy for data + infra; drive impact across ambiguous problem spaces.
- Lead a US-based remote engineering org with strong cross-functional collaboration.
- Healthcare context implies high governance/privacy requirements.
fitRationale:
- Very aligned to enterprise data platform leadership + AI/analytics enablement at org scale.
- Strong ‘data as product’ leadership role with room to shape governance, standards, and execution rigor.
- Regulated domain (healthcare) matches your governance/compliance focus.

title: Sr. Director, Data Platform Engineering & Operations
shortDescription:
- Lead SIE’s data + AI platform ecosystem (streaming/ingestion/warehouse, governance/observability).
- Operate at massive scale (millions of users; billions of data points/day).
- Stack mentions: Kafka, Databricks, Snowflake; governance tools (Alation/Collibra).
- Bay Area role (San Mateo).
fitRationale:
- Enterprise-scale data/platform leadership with explicit governance + observability responsibilities.
- Strong bridge to AI platform strategy (Databricks/Snowflake + AI/ML adoption).
- Big-org cross-functional leadership very close to your current operating environment.

title: Chief Architect
shortDescription:
- Transformation role: lead multi-year modernization from monolith to AWS cloud-native microservices.
- Own architectural governance (standards, decision-making, review) and exec-level roadmap translation.
- Guide parallel-run migration strategy (legacy + modern), balancing tech debt vs new capabilities.
- Partner with security/ops/product; mentions AI-driven product capabilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong fit for platform modernization + governance + executive alignment strengths.
- Clear value on operating model + standards at scale, not just technical design.
- Good narrative for ‘trust at scale’: migration, reliability, compliance, and AI capability delivery.

title: Chief Architect
shortDescription:
- Define architectural vision + prioritize platform-level investments; report to CTO and partner with VPs of Engineering.
- Architect scalable SaaS + cloud-native systems including data platforms that support AI/ML workloads at scale.
- Embed responsible AI (fairness/transparency/privacy) + data governance + model lifecycle management.
- Establish and enforce architecture standards, policies, and best practices across engineering/IT/security.
fitRationale:
- Direct hit on responsible AI + governance + platform modernization (your ‘trust at scale’ theme).
- Strong cross-functional scope (engineering + IT + security) with standards and decision forums.
- Smaller than mega-enterprise, but the architecture + AI governance mandate is unusually explicit.

title: Chief Technology Officer
shortDescription:
- Lead all of Overstory’s technology: software product, ML models, internal tools, and underlying platform.
- Define 12–36 month technical vision/strategy; partner closely with product leadership and the board.
- Scale a remote, multi-country engineering org; hire aggressively and build leadership bench.
- Domain: AI + satellite imagery / remote sensing for utility wildfire and outage risk reduction.
fitRationale:
- Compelling AI + data platform mandate (ML product + platform + tooling) with clear exec ownership.
- Opportunity to bring ‘trust at scale’ patterns (governance, reliability, safety-by-design) into critical infrastructure context.
- Tradeoff: smaller org vs enterprise, but high strategic leverage if you want end-to-end CTO scope.

title: Senior Director - Cloud Platform Engineering
shortDescription:
- Own production reliability/stability for site + infrastructure + cloud platform services; lead Sev0/Sev1 incident response and exec comms.
- Personally lead data center exit and AWS migration end-to-end; decommission on-prem dependencies.
- Build a durable operating model (SLIs/SLOs, error budgets, on-call/escalation, change management, postmortems).
- Drive platform maturity: EKS/Kubernetes, IaC, CI/CD, observability, DR, FinOps, self-service platform capabilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong fit for enterprise-grade reliability + governance + operating-model design (SRE disciplines, error budgets, exec-level incident posture).
- Cloud migration + platform standardization maps well to your modernization + trust themes.
- Good ‘platform as product’ story with measurable outcomes (availability, MTTR, toil reduction, cost visibility).

title: Senior Vice President of Engineering
shortDescription:
- Define and execute engineering vision/strategy aligned with product roadmap for Zeenea’s data intelligence platform.
- Lead transformation for global scale: processes, tools, culture, org structure, and delivery metrics.
- Own technical strategy across AI, connectivity, and cloud operations; ensure scalability, performance, and security.
- Build/mentor senior leaders; scale engineering across geographies; engage customers/partners on integration strategy.
fitRationale:
- Directly aligned to enterprise data platform + governance outcomes (making data trusted and accessible).
- Strong operating-model + metrics + engineering excellence charter (CI/CD, DevOps, observability) that matches your scale playbook.
- Customer/partner integration focus maps to your interoperability + platform ecosystem strengths.

title: VP, Technology Engineering
shortDescription:
- Executive engineering leader supporting President + Construction/Operations on selecting/deploying data center technologies.
- Drive technical + financial evaluations (TCO, EOL timelines, MTBF validation) and bake SLAs into purchase agreements.
- Influence new builds and retrofits; cover electrical/mechanical/security/fire/structural aspects of data center design.
- Translate deep technical choices into exec-ready decisions and business outcomes.
fitRationale:
- Adjacent to core platform work, but strong ‘reliability at scale’ DNA (SLA rigor, lifecycle management, systems thinking).
- If you want closer exposure to hyperscale infrastructure economics/engineering, this is a credible exec role.
- Tradeoff: more physical infrastructure than software/data platform leadership.

title: Vice President of Engineering
shortDescription:
- Scale and lead engineering as a core exec team member; define and execute platform vision/architecture/roadmap.
- Build scalable infrastructure + third-party integrations; deliver full-stack user experiences.
- Establish delivery/QA/incident response processes; implement engineering KPIs and manage technical debt.
- Mentioned: regulated healthcare domain; interest in AI-powered personalization capabilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong fit if you want a hands-on exec build role with explicit platform + integrations scope and room to install governance/operating cadence.
- Regulated domain creates natural pull for your compliance + trust framing (privacy, auditability).
- Tradeoff: smaller Series A company vs your enterprise preference.
